Damberd.opmerking: Sedert 3 februari 1978 werd op de Koornmarkt het aloude caf√© Het Damberd tot een jazzcaf√© ‚Äúomgeturnd‚Äù. ‚ÄúSinds 1750 is hier ononderbroken een caf√© gevestigd onder de naam Damberd. Dammen was toen een populair tijdverdrijf. Het gebouw zelf dateert uit de 13de eeuw en heeft nog dienst gedaan als graanopslagplaats,‚Äù aldus jazz-bassist Paul Feyaerts (¬∞1947) in de Gazet Van Antwerpen van 26 februari 2008.

Victory_Club.opmerking: night spot opened at 23, rue de Stassart, Brussels by F√©lix R. Faecq, Jacques Kluger and a third associate. Opening date: December 16, 1944 and closed on February 1, 1946 (Later on the Discotrade Company also produced the MAGIC label). The "house-band" was led by GUS DELOOF and numerous recordings were made (in the studio, rue Gallait, Brussels), including several guest stars who appeared in the Victory Club

Cultuur_7.opmerking: In October 2015, Stingray Digital in Canada acquired Cultuur 7. On 1 December 2015, Cultuur 7 was closed down, and was replaced by the Dutch version of Brava (Stingray acquired the broadcaster in the Netherlands earlier in July 2015); Cultuur 7's programmes were integrated into the new Brava's schedule.

Chantal.dixit_Pernet: DISQUE CHANTAL - Compagnie Belge Chantal (then Compagnie Chantal). This company, established in Ghent at the beginning of the Century and owned by the brothers Lucien & Julien Moeremans had its own pressing plant in Belgium. They later started an association with British BROADCAST Company (BROADCAST records to be found in Belgium were labeled "Fabriqu√© en Belgique par la Compagnie Vocalion-Chantal") until its bankruptcy in 1932. Broadcast was taken over for some months by EDISON BELL Ltd., London and then by the Janssens family, founders of SOBEDI Co., Brussels. Most of the orchestral recordings appearing on CHANTAL label were issued under "commercial" pseudonyms such as ORCHESTRE DE DANSE CHANTAL, MUSIQUE MILITAIRE CHANTAL, ORCHESTRE DE DANSE DE LA COUR DE LONDRES, JAZZ-BAND CHANTAL, SUPER-JAZZ CHANTAL etc. Various foreign matrices appear on CHANTAL records, notably from US-GENNETT, VOCALION, also British ACO and VOCALION. Some titles are played by such bands as JEFFRIES RIALTO ORCHESTRA, BEN BERNIE, EMIL COLEMAN, THE CALIFORNIA RAMBLERS, BAILEY'S LUCKY SEVEN, BAR HARBOR SOCIETY ORCHESTRA, RUDY WIEDOEFT'S CALIFORNIANS, THE YERKES S.S. FLOTILLA ORCHESTRA & similar Jazz/Dance bands. Original recordings made in Belgium by & for CHANTAL company offer many vocal sides, military music, operatic, symphonic, also popular dance numbers played by a studio-band led by pianist and musical-director of the company, Mademoiselle Bryant. The few Jazz & Ragtime sides recorded by the CHANTAL Company are to be found under MICHEL BAUDE, JIM BURY, JULES DIRICKX, JOSEPH FIERS, JAZZ-BAND CHANTAL, JAZZ BAND MIAMI, ORCHESTRE DE DANSE CHANTAL, RED DICES ORCHESTRA, LOUIS ROWIE, SERVAIS & ROCOURT

Rainbow.extra: specialized in releases from local Flemish artists. Later it became a music publishing company and a booking agency. Associated with pressing plant Harry's Belgium.

oa Bettonville en de Radzitzky in de redactie, ging later op in Hot Club Magazine, het magazine verscheen ook kort in het NL.

Jazz_Bilzen__Tijd_voor_muziek__en_veel_m.titel: Jazz Bilzen: Tijd voor muziek (en veel meer...) 1965-1981
Jazz_Bilzen__Tijd_voor_muziek__en_veel_m.info: Jazz Bilzen was one of the important jazz festivals in Belgium, from 1965 through 1978 (jazz became marginal in the last years). Among the musicians who played there are Belgian musicians such as Jack Sels, Sadi, Toots Thielemans, Philip Catherine, Michel Herr, BRT Big band, Jack Van Poll (NL), and famous US jazzmen such as Dexter Gordon, Ornette Coleman, Dizzy Gillespie, Jaki Byard, John MacLaughlin, Charlie Mingus, Joe Henderson, etc...
